meanings.definition: To drain of strength or energy
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, Sarah felt sapped and tired.
meanings.sent2: The intense workout sapped all his energy.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending meetings sapped the team's enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The hot sun sapped the moisture from the soil.
meanings.sent5: The vampire sapped the life force from its victims.

meanings.definition: Weakened or exhausted by constant demands or exertion
meanings.sent1: The sapped athlete struggled to finish the race.
meanings.sent2: She felt sapped after working overtime for a week.
meanings.sent3: The sapped phone battery died before he could make the call.
meanings.sent4: The sapped tree branches drooped under the weight of snow.
meanings.sent5: The sapped enthusiasm of the crowd dampened the event.
